column4: can someone please help:  half my hdd space on my ubuntu partition is unnaccounted for. I have 100gig partition and my used space is 6gig and free space is 34gig.....
check the disk using the disk utility: alt + f2 and type: palimpsest
thanks
now what?
does it show that the partition occupy all of that 100 gigs ?
yup
what command are you using to check disk space?
was just right clicking in nautilus
i also did fdisk -l
df -h
/dev/sda4              97G   58G   35G  63% /
but theres no directories that contain the ammount of space that is missing
97G is total capacity (after formatting) .. 58 used and 35 free.. so looks fine
theres only 6.2gig used by my home folder though...
du --max-depth=1 -h
add / to the end if that's your root partition, otherwise, path the path to where you mounted it
ooh thats a usefull command
it says theres 46gig used by ./.config
add .config to the end of the command to limit it to that directory
ahh its coming from transmission
transmittion is reserving the space do you think?
yes it does
ah ok. thats solved then. thank you very much for your time :)
you're welcome
